job_title: Student Ambassador in Sarasota, FL
pros: Great management Great coworkers Fun job Relaxed environment
cons: Board of trustees takeover has made it much harder to speak with families

review_title: Wish things didn't change so much!
job_title: Part-time Student Employee in Sarasota, FL
pros: Co-workers are usually all amazing, most supervisors are very understanding of student class/work/life balance, parts of different on-campus jobs can be fun, and being on campus is nice.
cons: Student workers are overworked and underpaid, some departments are even known for having unpaid required hours. A few years ago RAs tried unionizing and the school tries really hard to stop that sort of thing from happening. Student workers don't get told where and how to contact HR about problems in the workplace. The new administration is very cruel, and their actions have made working in certain departments much harder; a lot of great staff and students are leaving.

job_title: Admissions Operations Assistant in Sarasota, FL
pros: This job was good for the first about year and a half that I worked there. If my original director was still employed there, chances are I would still be at NCF.
cons: The person who was my director the last few months I was employed at NCF is a micromanager who made my work life hell; tracked my activity in the CRM, had their friends in the office counting my bathroom breaks and telling them that I was slacking. HR was little to no help. This place went from decent to worst place to work pretty quickly.

job_title: Licensed Counselor (LADAC, LPC, LCSW, LMFT) in Sarasota, FL
pros: Beautiful small college setting Strong education
cons: Ron DeSantis “transformation” and abolition of anything related to diversity

job_title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in Sarasota, FL
pros: Very reasonable professors that understand that you do not have infinite amounts of time to be grading or answering questions from students. There were always healthy expectations and they were open to helping and making suggestions when I wasn't sure about something.
cons: Very small college so you are very likely to know your students and have them ask you things outside of your office hours. Also usually only one or two TAs so you have to make sure you carry your weight.

job_title: Research Assistant in Sarasota, FL
pros: flexible, good experience, nice boss
cons: the base pay is relatively low

review_title: Great Job, Great Managers, Student Pay
job_title: Fitness Center Staff Assistant in Sarasota, FL
pros: Great managers, hours, flexibility, communication. Work was simple and easy. Manager will go out on a limb for you.
cons: Low pay, and if they could pay you less, they probably would. Not really the managers fault, its mostly the school admin. This is fine if its a side job as a student, but fails as a bridge job between the summer after graduation and work world. They should raise the pay to at least 10, even for students. If you can handle low pay and just need gas money while in school, this might be the best job on campus.

job_title: Student Fundraiser in Sarasota, FL
pros: If you work on a Sunday you get food. Also, New College is the most Magical place for students and professors and the administration is terrible. I understand the low pay, I don't understand how an administration could market New College as a unique sciency place and then hate everything about the student culture.
cons: The food can sometimes be quite terrible and lazy, the pay is terrible, the work isn't fun (not their fault), and I didn't particularly like the management

job_title: Director of Philanthropy in Sarasota, FL
pros: Wonderful environment, great team, professional staff and good benefits.
cons: Campus physical plant needs improvement.

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Sarasota, FL
pros: freedom to teach what/how you want, this is a place to develop your teaching portfolio and experiment, faculty dedication to students, some really wonderfully creative students, small class sizes where you get to know each student well, strong faculty governance, collapsed hierarchies, you know all the administrators by name
cons: unequal faculty workloads, silo culture, miscommunication or lack of communication, lack of cohesive community, lack of structure, narrative evaluations (I understand the philosophy behind it, but some students will try to find the sweet spot of trying to do as little as possible and still get a satisfactory mark for the class)

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Orlando, FL
pros: access to all studios tools, Taught how to use all of the machines
cons: nothing to write in here

job_title: Student Event Assistant in Sarasota, FL
pros: Great experience for a student. A lot of exposure and amazing supervisor
cons: Demanding job, with hours after class

job_title: Student Services in Sarasota, FL
pros: Pretty campus grounds, on Sarasota Bay.
cons: Administration and senior leadership is incompetent, and has no regard or respect for staff or students. Unprofessionalism is a hallmark.

job_title: Faculty/Staff in Sarasota, FL
pros:
Pretty campus, gorgeous location - right on the Bay.
Small college atmosphere allows faculty and staff to get to know students well. 
Many of the students are exceptional and great to work with. 
Some great people in this organization.
cons:
Entire university seems disorganized, unfocused, and plummeting downward.
There is a serious clash between the "old guard" and anyone trying to bring in new ideas; therefore, the old guard seems to be constantly trying to restructure departments, find a new/old vision for the school, and, at times, it seems they are just trying to survive. 
Far too many students, faculty, and staff seem very bitter and negative...and in the case of faculty and staff, it is clear many have stayed there to long. This causes serious dissension in departments, at times an environment bordering on the hostile.
The students have far too much power and will respond strongly if they are questioned or told, No.
For being an alleged diverse and open minded school, anyone with conservative ideals may not necessarily feel very welcomed here.

job_title: Adjunct Assistant Professor in Sarasota, FL
pros:
In a word, the students. They were a joy to work with and teach, and were eager to learn the material. Bright, curious, and creative!
The faculty are kind and dedicated, although a few of the old guard need to get into the 21st century or retire. Young blood is needed in the ranks. Idyllic location, cozy feel on campus. The new president Donal O'Shea seems to be a good choice for leadership. I had complete freedom in my course in every respect.
cons: Salaries are low, but the teaching load was undemanding. Low turnover and no growth in the student body means faculty stay forever, a bit too long. Facilities are low tech. Over reliance on adjuncts as opposed to hiring new faculty with innovative ideas that could breathe some life into the school.

job_title: Library Assistant in Sarasota, FL
pros: Innovative work environment, beautiful campus, nice co-workers. It is a very good job to gain experience if you are interested in gaining a MLS.
cons: Poor management and disorganized. Very hard to get people - not many opportunities to move up with the college.

review_title: Great place to work in higher ed
job_title: Cafe Manager in Sarasota, FL
pros: The community is small and comfortable
cons: Sometimes communication between different divisions can be disorganized

job_title: Chemistry Teaching Assistant in Bradenton, FL
pros: Eclectic students who are eager to learn. Employer pays promptly.
cons: Can't think of any, except maybe one supervisor I had was very hands-off.

job_title: Web Developer in Sarasota, FL
pros: it's a small school so you can know everyone
cons: they have a smaller budget than pretty much any other school in the world

review_title: Review of Housing and Residence Life Staff
job_title: Resident Advisor in Sarasota, FL
pros: Flexible hours, empathetic and competent staff
cons: The pay is not as competitive as it could be.

review_title: Great job! Many opportunities and kind management.
job_title: Fitness Center Help Desk in Sarasota, FL
pros: Friendly staff and students. Flexible hours. Good management.
cons: Minimum wage pay. No benefits.

job_title: Student Library Assistant in Sarasota, FL
pros: On campus, awesome people, not much stress
cons: Not a good start for your career.

job_title: Student Assistant in Sarasota, FL
pros: Self made schedule, minimal expectations, convenient
cons: It's a student job, there's not much to say
